items.title: What the latest Epstein files release reveals, and where Trump is mentioned
items.standfirst: The Justice Department released nearly 30,000 more pages of documents related to the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, including many that reference President Donald Trump. The new batch comes as the DOJ is being criticized for heavily redacting many of the files and not releasing all…

items.title: Lawmakers raise new questions about Trump after latest Epstein drop
items.standfirst: The Department of Justice’s latest release of nearly 30,000 more Jeffrey Epstein files on Tuesday pointed to a number of previously unknown connections between Epstein and President Donald Trump — and Democrats want answers. “The new DOJ documents raise serious questions about the relationship…
items.content: The Department of Justice’s latest release of nearly 30,000 more Jeffrey Epstein files on Tuesday pointed to a number of previously unknown connections between Epstein and President Donald Trump — and Democrats want answers. “The new DOJ documents raise serious questions about the relationship…

items.title: Newly released Epstein files include references to Donald Trump
items.standfirst: Files also include details about Epstein’s relationship with Larry Summers and apparently fake letter to Larry NassarA newly released batch of the so-called Epstein files on Tuesday includes many references to Donald Trump, including a claim by a senior US attorney that the US president was on a flight in the 1990s with the now-deceased convicted child sex offender and a 20-year-old woman.There is no indication of whether the woman was a victim of any crime, and being included in the files does not indicate any criminal wrongdoing. Continue reading...
items.content: Files also include details about Epstein’s relationship with Larry Summers and apparently fake letter to Larry NassarA newly released batch of the so-called Epstein files on Tuesday includes many references to Donald Trump, including a claim by a senior US attorney that the US president was on a flight in the 1990s with the now-deceased convicted child sex offender and a 20-year-old woman.There is no indication of whether the woman was a victim of any crime, and being included in the files does not indicate any criminal wrongdoing. Continue reading...

items.title: DoJ says Jeffrey Epstein letter to Larry Nassar referencing Trump is fake
items.standfirst: Justice department says FBI confirmed letter is fake and lists why it was not deemed genuine by authoritiesUS politics live – latest updatesThe Department of Justice said on Tuesday afternoon that a disturbing letter released as part of the Epstein files and appearing to be from the late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein to convicted sex abuser and former Olympic gymnastics coach Larry Nassar is a fake.The contents of the purported letter dated 2019 were released by the DoJ early on Tuesday and had appeared to have been written by Epstein to Nassar and discussed a love of “young ladies”. Continue reading...
items.content: Justice department says FBI confirmed letter is fake and lists why it was not deemed genuine by authoritiesUS politics live – latest updatesThe Department of Justice said on Tuesday afternoon that a disturbing letter released as part of the Epstein files and appearing to be from the late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein to convicted sex abuser and former Olympic gymnastics coach Larry Nassar is a fake.The contents of the purported letter dated 2019 were released by the DoJ early on Tuesday and had appeared to have been written by Epstein to Nassar and discussed a love of “young ladies”. Continue reading...

items.content: The Department of Justice has been publicly posting files related to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation since Friday.(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)

items.title: Jes Staley and Larry Summers made executors of Jeffrey Epstein’s estate, files reveal
items.standfirst: Former Barclays boss and ex-US Treasury secretary named in versions of will of convicted child sex offenderThe former Barclays chief executive Jes Staley and the ex-US Treasury secretary Larry Summers were appointed as executors of Jeffrey Epstein’s estate, according to a newly released tranche of documents linked to the deceased child sex offender.Filings published on Tuesday by the US Department of Justice included various versions of Epstein’s last will and testament, which showed the financier intended to hand responsibility of managing his affairs to associates including the two high-profile men in the event of his death. Continue reading...
items.content: Former Barclays boss and ex-US Treasury secretary named in versions of will of convicted child sex offenderThe former Barclays chief executive Jes Staley and the ex-US Treasury secretary Larry Summers were appointed as executors of Jeffrey Epstein’s estate, according to a newly released tranche of documents linked to the deceased child sex offender.Filings published on Tuesday by the US Department of Justice included various versions of Epstein’s last will and testament, which showed the financier intended to hand responsibility of managing his affairs to associates including the two high-profile men in the event of his death. Continue reading...

items.title: Supreme Court blocks Trump’s National Guard deployment in Chicago
items.standfirst: The US Supreme Court on Tuesday halted President Donald Trump’s attempt to deploy National Guard troops in Chicago, dealing a setback to his immigration crackdown and raising fresh questions about the limits of presidential authority to use the military for domestic law enforcement.
items.content: The US Supreme Court on Tuesday halted President Donald Trump’s attempt to deploy National Guard troops in Chicago, dealing a setback to his immigration crackdown and raising fresh questions about the limits of presidential authority to use the military for domestic law enforcement.

items.title: Brett Kavanaugh Issues ‘Future Crises’ Warning in Supreme Court Decision
items.standfirst: Justice Brett Kavanaugh said the Supreme Court’s decision on President Donald Trump’s deployment of the National Guard in Illinois could impact “future crises.” The Court denied an application on Tuesday to stay a lower court decision blocking the deployment of troops to support the Trump…
items.content: Justice Brett Kavanaugh said the Supreme Court’s decision on President Donald Trump’s deployment of the National Guard in Illinois could impact “future crises.” The Court denied an application on Tuesday to stay a lower court decision blocking the deployment of troops to support the Trump…

items.title: US supreme court blocks Trump bid to deploy national guard to Chicago
items.standfirst: In a 6-3 decision, the high court sided with a lower court ruling that blocked deployment of troops to the Illinois cityThe US supreme court refused on Tuesday to let Donald Trump send national guard troops to the Chicago area, in an important reining-in of the US president’s efforts to expand the use of the military for domestic purposes in historic moves against a growing number of Democratic-led jurisdictions.The nation’s highest court denied the US justice department’s request to lift a judge’s order in October that has blocked the deployment of hundreds of national guard personnel in a legal challenge brought by Illinois state officials and local leaders, who had opposed any federalization of those troops to offer backup to immigration enforcement. Continue reading...
items.content: In a 6-3 decision, the high court sided with a lower court ruling that blocked deployment of troops to the Illinois cityThe US supreme court refused on Tuesday to let Donald Trump send national guard troops to the Chicago area, in an important reining-in of the US president’s efforts to expand the use of the military for domestic purposes in historic moves against a growing number of Democratic-led jurisdictions.The nation’s highest court denied the US justice department’s request to lift a judge’s order in October that has blocked the deployment of hundreds of national guard personnel in a legal challenge brought by Illinois state officials and local leaders, who had opposed any federalization of those troops to offer backup to immigration enforcement. Continue reading...

items.title: Supreme Court says Trump can't deploy National Guard to Chicago for now
items.standfirst: President Trump invoked a law called Title 10 to bring members of the Illinois National Guard under federal service over the objections of state and local leaders.
items.content: President Trump invoked a law called Title 10 to bring members of the Illinois National Guard under federal service over the objections of state and local leaders.

items.title: Supreme Court blocks Trump administration from deploying National Guard in Illinois
items.standfirst: The Supreme Court ruled on Tuesday that President Trump cannot deploy the National Guard troops to Chicago as a legal challenge moves ahead. CBS News immigration and politics reporter Camilo Montoya-Galvez has the latest.
items.content: The Supreme Court ruled on Tuesday that President Trump cannot deploy the National Guard troops to Chicago as a legal challenge moves ahead. CBS News immigration and politics reporter Camilo Montoya-Galvez has the latest.

items.title: Supreme Court rules against Trump in National Guard case
items.standfirst: The U.S. Supreme Court ruled against President Trump on Tuesday, refusing to reinstate, for now, Trump's ability to send National Guard troops into the state of Illinois over the objections of the governor.
items.content: The U.S. Supreme Court ruled against President Trump on Tuesday, refusing to reinstate, for now, Trump's ability to send National Guard troops into the state of Illinois over the objections of the governor.(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)

clusters.title: US bars five Europeans over alleged pressure on tech firms to censor speech
clusters.neutral_headline: US denies visas to ex-EU commissioner and others over social media rules

items.title: US bars five Europeans over alleged pressure on tech firms to censor speech
items.standfirst: The US State Department said Tuesday that it has barred five Europeans accused of leading efforts to pressure US technology companies into censoring or suppressing American viewpoints, in a move that sharpens tensions with European regulators over online speech.
items.content: The US State Department said Tuesday that it has barred five Europeans accused of leading efforts to pressure US technology companies into censoring or suppressing American viewpoints, in a move that sharpens tensions with European regulators over online speech.

items.title: Former EU commissioner and activists barred from US in attack on European tech regulators
items.standfirst: State department accuses group of pressuring tech firms to censor or suppress American viewpoints through regulation of disinformationThe state department has barred five Europeans from the US, accusing them of leading efforts to pressure tech firms to censor or suppress American viewpoints, in the latest attack on European regulations that target hate speech and misinformation.Secretary of state Marco Rubio said the five people targeted with visa bans – who include former European Commissioner Thierry Breton – have led “organized efforts to coerce American platforms to censor, demonetize, and suppress American viewpoints they oppose.” Continue reading...
items.content: State department accuses group of pressuring tech firms to censor or suppress American viewpoints through regulation of disinformationThe state department has barred five Europeans from the US, accusing them of leading efforts to pressure tech firms to censor or suppress American viewpoints, in the latest attack on European regulations that target hate speech and misinformation.Secretary of state Marco Rubio said the five people targeted with visa bans – who include former European Commissioner Thierry Breton – have led “organized efforts to coerce American platforms to censor, demonetize, and suppress American viewpoints they oppose.” Continue reading...

"These radical activists…

items.title: US Sanctions Former EU Official, Others in Swipe at Europe
items.standfirst: The Trump administration on Tuesday imposed visa sanctions on former European Union Commissioner Thierry Breton and four other people for trying to make American tech companies police political speech on their platforms.
items.content: The Trump administration on Tuesday imposed visa sanctions on former European Union Commissioner Thierry Breton and four other people for trying to make American tech companies police political speech on their platforms.

clusters.title: Libya’s army chief dies in plane crash in Turkey

items.title: Libya’s army chief dies in plane crash in Turkey
items.standfirst: Libyan PM says Mohammed Ali Ahmed al-Haddad died after aircraft lost radio contact above AnkaraThe Libyan army’s chief of staff, Mohammed Ali Ahmed al-Haddad, has been killed in a plane crash after leaving Turkey’s capital, Ankara.The prime minister of Libya’s internationally recognised government confirmed on Tuesday evening that Mohammed Ali Ahmed al-Haddad had died and that four others were on the jet with him. Continue reading...
items.content: Libyan PM says Mohammed Ali Ahmed al-Haddad died after aircraft lost radio contact above AnkaraThe Libyan army’s chief of staff, Mohammed Ali Ahmed al-Haddad, has been killed in a plane crash after leaving Turkey’s capital, Ankara.The prime minister of Libya’s internationally recognised government confirmed on Tuesday evening that Mohammed Ali Ahmed al-Haddad had died and that four others were on the jet with him. Continue reading...

items.title: Libya's army chief killed in air crash in Turkey
items.standfirst: Signal was earlier lost with a jet that took off from Ankara with Gen Mohammed Ali Ahmed al-Haddad and four others on board.
items.content: Signal was earlier lost with a jet that took off from Ankara with Gen Mohammed Ali Ahmed al-Haddad and four others on board.

items.title: Five dead in plane crash over Turkey
items.standfirst: The military chief of Libya has been killed alongside four others in a plane crash in Turkey.
items.content: The military chief of Libya has been killed alongside four others in a plane crash in Turkey.

items.title: Libyan army chief of staff found dead in plane wreckage, PM says
items.standfirst: Libyan military chief Muhammad Ali Ahmad al Haddad and four others died in a plane crash in Turkey on Tuesday evening, Prime Minister Abdulhamid Dbeibah has confirmed. Turkey's air traffic controllers lost contact with a jet carrying the Libyan delegation that was heading home after a visit to Ankara, the Turkish interior minister said.
items.content: Libyan military chief Muhammad Ali Ahmad al Haddad and four others died in a plane crash in Turkey on Tuesday evening, Prime Minister Abdulhamid Dbeibah has confirmed. Turkey's air traffic controllers lost contact with a jet carrying the Libyan delegation that was heading home after a visit to Ankara, the Turkish interior minister said.

clusters.title: 3 dead, 20 injured in nursing home explosion in Bristol, Pennsylvania, officials say
clusters.neutral_headline: At least two dead in Pennsylvania nursing home explosion

items.title: 3 dead, 20 injured in nursing home explosion in Bristol, Pennsylvania, officials say
items.standfirst: Three people were killed and 20 more injured in an explosion at a nursing home in Bristol, Pennsylvania, officials said.
items.content: Three people were killed and 20 more injured in an explosion at a nursing home in Bristol, Pennsylvania, officials said.

items.title: 2 killed, several missing after nursing home explosion in Pennsylvania
items.standfirst: Two people are dead after an explosion at a nursing home in Bristol, Pennsylvania, and several are still missing, Gov. Josh Shapiro said. CBS Philadelphia reporter Nikki DeMentri reports.
items.content: Two people are dead after an explosion at a nursing home in Bristol, Pennsylvania, and several are still missing, Gov. Josh Shapiro said. CBS Philadelphia reporter Nikki DeMentri reports.

items.title: At least two dead in Pennsylvania nursing home explosion
items.standfirst: Five people are still unaccounted for but crews have rescued multiple people from the partially collapsed building, officials say.
items.content: Five people are still unaccounted for but crews have rescued multiple people from the partially collapsed building, officials say.

items.title: Explosion at a Pennsylvania nursing home kills at least 2, governor says
items.standfirst: The explosion collapsed a part of the building and happened just as a utility crew had been on site looking for a gas leak at Bristol Health & Rehab Center in Bristol Township, just outside Philadelphia.
items.content: The explosion collapsed a part of the building and happened just as a utility crew had been on site looking for a gas leak at Bristol Health & Rehab Center in Bristol Township, just outside Philadelphia.(Image credit: Monica Herndon/The Philadelphia Inquirer)

items.title: At least two people dead in Philadelphia nursing home explosion
items.standfirst: Five additional people unaccounted for after partial building collapse at Silver Lake center in Bristol TownshipAn explosion at a nursing home just outside Philadelphia collapsed part of the building and has left at least two people dead, and five others unaccounted for. The exact number of those injured and trapped inside has yet to be announced, authorities said.The electric company Peco said in a statement that crews responded to reports of a gas odor at the site around 2pm. “While crews were on site, an explosion occurred at the facility,” the statement said. “PECO crews shut off natural gas and electric service to the facility to ensure the safety of first responders and local residents.” Continue reading...
items.content: Five additional people unaccounted for after partial building collapse at Silver Lake center in Bristol TownshipAn explosion at a nursing home just outside Philadelphia collapsed part of the building and has left at least two people dead, and five others unaccounted for. The exact number of those injured and trapped inside has yet to be announced, authorities said.The electric company Peco said in a statement that crews responded to reports of a gas odor at the site around 2pm. “While crews were on site, an explosion occurred at the facility,” the statement said. “PECO crews shut off natural gas and electric service to the facility to ensure the safety of first responders and local residents.” Continue reading...

items.title: At least 2 people killed in Pennsylvania nursing home explosion, Gov. Josh Shapiro says
items.standfirst: At least two people died in an explosion at a Pennsylvania nursing home on Tuesday, Gov. Josh Shapiro said at a news conference. Several are still missing.
items.content: At least two people died in an explosion at a Pennsylvania nursing home on Tuesday, Gov. Josh Shapiro said at a news conference. Several are still missing.

items.standfirst: Education Department To Start Garnishing Wages Of Defaulted Student Loan Borrowers In January As we and others have noted several times over the last year, the US government will be garnishing the wages of student loan borrowers in default - with actual garnishment now set to begin in January,…

items.title: Student loan borrowers in default may see wages garnished in 2026
items.standfirst: The Trump administration said on Tuesday that it will begin garnishing the wages of student loan borrowers who are in default early next year. The department said it will send notices to approximately 1,000 borrowers the week of January 7, with more notices to come at an increasing scale each…
items.content: The Trump administration said on Tuesday that it will begin garnishing the wages of student loan borrowers who are in default early next year. The department said it will send notices to approximately 1,000 borrowers the week of January 7, with more notices to come at an increasing scale each…

items.title: Student loan borrowers in default could see wages garnished in 2026
items.standfirst: The Education Department signaled earlier this year that it would move to resume wage garnishment, among other forms of involuntary collection, for those in default.
items.content: The Education Department signaled earlier this year that it would move to resume wage garnishment, among other forms of involuntary collection, for those in default.

items.title: Trump administration to resume wage garnishment for student loan defaulters
items.standfirst: Borrowers to receive wage garnishment notices starting January 7, Department of Education confirms.
items.content: Borrowers to receive wage garnishment notices starting January 7, Department of Education confirms.

items.title: Student loan borrowers in default may soon see their wages garnished
items.standfirst: About 5.5 million borrowers are currently in default. They haven't risked wage garnishment since the beginning of the pandemic, when policymakers paused the practice.
items.content: About 5.5 million borrowers are currently in default. They haven't risked wage garnishment since the beginning of the pandemic, when policymakers paused the practice.

items.title: Brazil's Supreme Court allows Bolsonaro to leave prison for surgery

items.content: Former president is granted permission to leave jail for a hernia operation on Christmas Day.

items.title: Brazil's Supreme Court allows Bolsonaro to leave prison for surgery on Christmas
items.standfirst: Brazil's Supreme Court granted a request by ex-president Jair Bolsonaro to leave prison to undergo surgery on Christmas for a hernia. Bolsonaro is currently serving a 27-year sentence after being convicted of plotting a coup to remain in power.
items.content: Brazil's Supreme Court granted a request by ex-president Jair Bolsonaro to leave prison to undergo surgery on Christmas for a hernia. Bolsonaro is currently serving a 27-year sentence after being convicted of plotting a coup to remain in power.

items.title: No charge over Bob Vylan IDF chants at Glastonbury
items.standfirst: Avon and Somerset Police says the incident "does not meet the criminal threshold" for prosecution.
items.content: Avon and Somerset Police says the incident "does not meet the criminal threshold" for prosecution.

items.title: Police end investigation into Bob Vylan’s IDF chants at Glastonbury
items.standfirst: Avon and Somerset police says there is ‘insufficient’ evidence for realistic prospect of convictionAn investigation into chants by the rap duo Bob Vylan at Glastonbury festival will not lead to any further action by prosecutors as there is “insufficient” evidence for a realistic prospect of conviction, police said.Bobby Vylan, whose real name is Pascal Robinson-Foster, led crowds on the festival’s West Holts stage in chants of “death, death to the IDF”, referring to the Israel Defense Forces, during their performance in June. Continue reading...
items.content: Avon and Somerset police says there is ‘insufficient’ evidence for realistic prospect of convictionAn investigation into chants by the rap duo Bob Vylan at Glastonbury festival will not lead to any further action by prosecutors as there is “insufficient” evidence for a realistic prospect of conviction, police said.Bobby Vylan, whose real name is Pascal Robinson-Foster, led crowds on the festival’s West Holts stage in chants of “death, death to the IDF”, referring to the Israel Defense Forces, during their performance in June. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Russian attacks kill three and cut power to freezing Ukrainian regions
clusters.neutral_headline: Russian attacks kill three and cut power to freezing Ukrainian regions

items.title: Russian attacks kill three and cut power to freezing Ukrainian regions
items.standfirst: Four-year-old child among those killed in drone and missile assault targeting energy infrastructureA massive Russian drone and missile attack on Ukraine has killed three people and cut power to several Ukrainian regions two days before Christmas and as the country enters a period of very cold weather.Russia sent more than 650 drones and more than 30 missiles into Ukraine in the attack, which began overnight and continued into Tuesday morning, local officials said. At least three people were killed, including a four-year-old child. Continue reading...
items.content: Four-year-old child among those killed in drone and missile assault targeting energy infrastructureA massive Russian drone and missile attack on Ukraine has killed three people and cut power to several Ukrainian regions two days before Christmas and as the country enters a period of very cold weather.Russia sent more than 650 drones and more than 30 missiles into Ukraine in the attack, which began overnight and continued into Tuesday morning, local officials said. At least three people were killed, including a four-year-old child. Continue reading...

items.title: Russia attacks Ukraine energy sector with drones and missiles strikes
items.standfirst: Russia fired more than 650 drones and three dozen missiles at Ukraine in a large-scale attack that began during the night and stretched into daylight hours Tuesday, officials said. At least three people were killed, including a 4-year-old child, two days before Christmas.
items.content: Russia fired more than 650 drones and three dozen missiles at Ukraine in a large-scale attack that began during the night and stretched into daylight hours Tuesday, officials said. At least three people were killed, including a 4-year-old child, two days before Christmas.

items.title: Russia launches major deadly missile and drone attack on Ukraine

clusters.neutral_headline: ServiceNow to Acquire Cybersecurity Startup Armis for About $7.75 Billion

items.title: ServiceNow to Acquire Cybersecurity Startup Armis for About $7.75 Billion
ServiceNow to acquire San Francisco cybersecurity startup Armis for $7.75B in cash
items.standfirst: Santa Clara-based ServiceNow announced it will acquire nine-year-old Armis for $7.75 billion in an all-cash transaction. The cybersecurity startup's founders previously served in the Israeli military's cyber intelligence division before launching the company.
items.content: Santa Clara-based ServiceNow announced it will acquire nine-year-old Armis for $7.75 billion in an all-cash transaction. The cybersecurity startup's founders previously served in the Israeli military's cyber intelligence division before launching the company.

items.title: ServiceNow acquires S.F. security startup for nearly $8 billion to beef up AI defenses
items.standfirst: Business software provider ServiceNow has agreed to buy San Francisco-based security startup Armis for nearly $8 billion in an all-cash deal.
items.content: Business software provider ServiceNow has agreed to buy San Francisco-based security startup Armis for nearly $8 billion in an all-cash deal.

items.title: Why ServiceNow Is Buying Cyber Startup Armis for $7.75 Billion
items.standfirst: ServiceNow President and COO Amit Zavery explains why the company agreed to buy the cybersecurity startup Armis in a deal valued at $7.75 billion. He speaks on "Bloomberg The Close." (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: ServiceNow President and COO Amit Zavery explains why the company agreed to buy the cybersecurity startup Armis in a deal valued at $7.75 billion. He speaks on "Bloomberg The Close." (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Nvidia Buyer Megaspeed Faces Smuggling Probe | Bloomberg Tech 12/23/2025
items.standfirst: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde discusses ServiceNow’s plan to buy cybersecurity startup Armis for $7.75 billion, its largest acquisition to date. Plus, Nvidia's biggest buyer in Southeast Asia, Megaspeed, faces a chip-smuggling probe. And it was supposed to be crypto’s big year, but some of the sector's billionaires have been hit hard by recent price drops. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde discusses ServiceNow’s plan to buy cybersecurity startup Armis for $7.75 billion, its largest acquisition to date. Plus, Nvidia's biggest buyer in Southeast Asia, Megaspeed, faces a chip-smuggling probe. And it was supposed to be crypto’s big year, but some of the sector's billionaires have been hit hard by recent price drops. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Big Nvidia Buyer Faces Smuggling Probe
items.standfirst: The US government is investigating whether Nvidia's biggest buyer in Southeast Asia has smuggled chips into China. Bloomberg’s Ian King discusses the details with Caroline Hyde on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: The US government is investigating whether Nvidia's biggest buyer in Southeast Asia has smuggled chips into China. Bloomberg’s Ian King discusses the details with Caroline Hyde on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Russia and China pledge support for Venezuela as Trump ratchets up pressure on Maduro
items.standfirst: Trump again called for Venezuela’s president to leave power and said the US would keep or sell the oil it had seizedChina and Russia have expressed support for Venezuela as it confronts a US blockade of sanctioned oil tankers, while Donald Trump continues to ramp up his pressure campaign on the South American country’s president, Nicolás Maduro.Amid reports of slowing activity at Venezuelan ports, the US president again called for Maduro to leave power, and reiterated that the US would keep or sell the oil it had seized off the coast of Venezuela in recent weeks. Continue reading...
